repository.rDescription: This site is a university repository providing access to the publication output of the institution. While over 13,000 items are listed only a few hundred are available in full text. The attractive site interface is fully available in German, Italian, French and English, including the background information and supporting documentation. It is possible to browse for materials produced within particular projects, as well as across the institution or by individual author. Three RSS feeds are available for anyone interested in keeping up-to-date with newly added materials, projects or other news items.

This site is a university repository providing access to the lecture notes and presentations used at the institution in an educational context. The contents reflect the interests of the institution and are particularly rich in material from the theoretical & applied science and technology fields. The site is still under construction and currently help and guidance material is unavailable. The site interface is available in Italian only
This site provides access to the output of the institution. Users may set up RSS feeds to be alerted to new content. The interface is available in English.

This is an extensive repository containing material relating to the American experience, a large portion of it digitised from the Library of Congress' collections. It includes, but is not limited to, images, monographs, sheet music, sound and visual recordings, pamphlets and posters. It is subdivided into over 100 thematic collections based on original documentation format, subject, author or donor. The site also benefits from an extensive range of background documentation and information on the creation, maintenance and development of this repository. Individual sections of the collection are periodically highlighted, and materials advising on the use of this repository's contents in a classroom situation are also provided. Each major subsection has a discrete site design and interface, although they are all part of the overarching whole.

repository.rName: American Museum of Natural History Scientific Publications
repository.postalAddress: Central Park West at 79th St., New York, NY 10024
repository.rDescription: This site is a institutional repository providing access to the publication output of the museum's scientific endeavours. The site includes articles in current and past issues of the AMNH scientific series. As such the material available here covers over a century of research in the anthropological, and natural history domains.

This site is a university repository providing access to the publication output of the institution.The site interface is available in Italian only. Users may set up Atom and RSS feeds to be updated on content.

A subject based repository for research materials on European integration and unification with materials from members of 15 institutions in Europe and the United States. The associated search engine AEIPlus allows simultaneous searching of both the AEI, and the European Research Papers Archive (ERPA), including the European Integration online Papers (EIOP).

repository.rRemarks: For each author a MARC21/RDA authority record is made and is enriched with biographical data. This can be access via a seperate OAI-PMH url: http://www.larramendi.es/i18n/oai/oai_aut.cmd

repository.rName: Biblioteka Cyfrowa KLF UW 9Digital Library of the Formal Linguistics Department at the University of Warsaw)

repository.rRemarks: Other items includes: Maps

This site provides access to the digitised collections of the institution. The interface is available in Polish and English. Users may set up RSS feeds to be alerted to new content.
repository.rRemarks: This site uses DjVu to display content.

repository.uName: Main Library of Warsaw University of Technology

repository.oName: Ecole nationale supérieure des Sciences de l'Information et des Bibliothèques
repository.rDescription: This site provides access to the collections and research of the institution. The interface is in French.

repository.postalAddress: RERO, Réseau des Bibliothèques de Suisse occidentale, Av. de la Gare 45, CH - 1920 MARTIGNY
repository.rDescription: This site is an institutional repository providing access to the publication output of participating members of the RERO organisation (the Library Network of Western Switzerland). repository.rName: Bibliothèque numérique, Amazonie, plateau des Guyanes (Digital library on the Caribbean, the Amazon, the Guyana Plateau)
repository.oName: Université des Antilles et de la Guyane
repository.rDescription: This site provides access to the collection of materials relating to the Caribbean, the Amazon, the Guyana Plateau and regions or areas of interest related to these territories. The interface is in French. Manioc has several private and public partnerships as Conseil général and Ville de Pointe-à-Pitre in Guadeloupe, Conseil général in Guyane, Fondation Clément in Martinique. Access to external sites fo related interest are provided.

repository.uName: Centre d'études Supérieures de la Renaissance
repository.postalAddress: Centre d'Études Supérieures de la Renaissance, Université François Rabelais,, Tours - UMR 6576 du CNRS, 59, rue Néricault-D
repository.rDescription: This subject based repository collects and provides information relating to the humanities and the period of the Renaissance in particular. Principal materials are a wide range of digitised books from the period, available as a series of page images. The site interface is available in French only. Whilst the site has aspirations to include 2000 items over the coming years, there remains a considerable amount of work to achieve this target.
repository.rRemarks: Partners: Centre d'Études Supérieures de la Renaissance (Université François-Rabelais - CNRS), Institut de Recherche et d'Histoire des Textes (CNRS)

repository.rDescription: This site is an institutional repository providing access to the research output of the institution. The interface is available in Spanish.

This subject based repository site contains articles solely from two authors (Shimshon Bichler and Jonathan Nitzan) working in the area of political economy. A monthly email alert is available for interested parties to be informed of new material added to the site.

repository.oName: Bibliothèque Interuniversitaire de la Communauté française de Belgique
repository.rDescription: This repository provides access to phD theses output of the French Community of Belgium. Participating institutions are Faculté Polytechnique de Mons, Faculté Universitaire des Sciences Agronomiques de Gembloux, Facultés Universitaires Catholiques de Mons, Facultés Universitaires Notre-Dame de la Paix de Namur, Facultés Universitaires Saint-Louis, Université catholique de Louvain, Université Libre de Bruxelles, Université de Liège and Université de Mons-Hainaut.

This site is an institutional repository providing full text access to the dissertations and theses produced at the University of Liege, notably those submitted from October 2006 onwards. Not all theses are accessible via open access, with some restricted to local users only. However, the site is exceptionally clear in this demarcation using a two colour scheme to indicate the difference. The site interface is in French, but queries can be made in French or English. The site includes a range of guidance and background information.

This site is an institutional based repository for conference proceedings. The site interface is available in both English and German versions. At time of initial review, only conferences concerning informatics and computing have been added.

This site is an institutional digital archive containing a variety of materials deposited by the librarians. These include journals of the German enlightenment, manuscripts and digitised rare prints from the 15th to 20th century. Each section has its own interface and search engine. The site is available in English and German, with portions of the search interface in the latter only.
This site provides access to the records of the institution. The interface is available in French.
This site provides access to the research output of the institution. Some items are not available as full text, or only available as an abstract. The interface is available in English.
This site provides access to the digitised collections of the consortium. The interface is available in English. Content is available in various languages.
repository.rRemarks: The Biodiversity Heritage Library (BHL) is a consortium of 12 natural history and botanical libraries that cooperate to digitize and make accessible the legacy literature of biodiversity held in their collections.

repository.rRemarks: Other items include: Channel Islands View student newspaper & university documentation.

repository.rDescription: This is a small institutionally based repository containing transcripts of interviews with notable Caltech members of staff. The audio portions of the interviews are not provided on this site. Part of the Caltech Online Digital Archives (CODA) project.
repository.rRemarks: Partners: Gladys Krieble Delmas Foundation

repository.rDescription: This site is an institutional repository providing access to the publication output of Caltech. The largest proportion of this repository is made up of post-print articles. Materials are available from 1914 to the present day. As would be expected the technical nature of the institution means that these works are largely concerned with aspects of applied mathematics, science and technology. Each of the works included are reviewed and certified by at least one faculty member in the department before addition to the site. Part of the Caltech Online Digital Archives (CODA) project.
repository.rRemarks: Incoroprates Caltech Books

repository.rDescription: This is an institutional repository providing access to the student theses produced at the university. By the nature of the university the majority of the theses available on this site are in areas of applied science, mathematics and technology. However, a small number of social science related theses are mounted on this site. Users may set up Atom and RSS feeds to be alerted to new content.
This site provides access to the output of conferences. Users may set up Atom and RSS feeds to be alerted to new content. The interface is available in English.
repository.rRemarks: CaltechCONF is part of CODA, the Caltech Collection of Open Digital Archives, managed by Caltech Library Services.

repository.rName: Canadian Breast Cancer Research Alliance Open Access Archive
repository.postalAddress: 375 University Avenue, 6th floor, Toronto, ON, M5G 2J5
repository.rDescription: This repository contains research papers resulting from the research funded by the Canadian Breast Cancer Research Alliance, a unique partnership of public, private and non-profit organizations. The articles are arranged in collections that correlate to six research categories: Early Detection, Prevention/Risk Factors, Treatment, Fundamental Laboratory Investigation, Quality of Life and Health Services.
repository.rRemarks: This respository is hosted by ResearchSpace at the University of Toronto. This repository is in reality just a DSpace community within the University of Toronto's ResearchSpace repository. At the time of registration (Sep.2006) it was the only community. However, the administrators says that other communities will eventually be added.

repository.rDescription: This site provides access to the research output of the institution. Most items are not available as full-text. Users may set up RSS feeds to be alerted to new content.

repository.uName: Center for Advanced Study in the Social Sciences

Many texts are in English but there is a small proportion in other languages.

repository.rDescription: This site provides access to the research output of the institution. The majority of items are only available as bibliographic records, however a few clearly marked full-text items are available. The interface is available in a mixture of French and English.

repository.rDescription: This site is a subject based repository for materials pertaining to Jewish history. The site is especially rich in digitised books, posters and other images relating to aspects of Jewish history. The site has a good user interface allowing easy filtering and review of items found through the custom search engine. Context sensitive help is available on each page via the question-mark symbol.

repository.rName: Central and Eastern European Marine Repository

repository.oName: Organisation Européenne pour la Recherche Nucléaire
repository.rDescription: This site is an institutional repository for the European Organization for Nuclear Research (CERN). The size value here reflects the current number of full-text only items. The site includes a total number of records in excess of 800,000, with the majority being metadata (bibliographic) entries only. The site is well supported with a vast range of guidance documentation for academics and researchers wishing to constitute materials. The site interface is available in 19 languages and includes a meeting scheduler tool.

The repository accepts a wide variety of material, Including books, book chapters, journal articles, conference papers, presentation, and datasets. Registered users can subscribe to email alerts and RSS feeds to notify them of newly added content. The site is well supported with guidance and help materials.

repository.rDescription: This site is a repository for thesis and dissertations produced in 5 Portuguese universities who are members of DiTeD. Interestingly the majority of the records and theses are for those published in the areas of art, recreation, entertainment and sports studies. The site interface is available in Portuguese, English and Italian, although information on the DiTeD programme is only available in the orignal native langauage.

repository.rDescription: This site is a catalogue of historical maps, atlases and charts; which contains a few open access items. By and large the majority of the items available on this site are available in metadata forms only, and are held locally as physical objects. While twelve thousand bibliographic entries are listed on the site only a very limited number of maps and book plates available openly accessible. Currently only the Schwedische Landesaufnahme maps are all available, and a browser plug-in is required for download before they may be correctly viewed. The site administrators notes that it is hoped to expand on the repository with additional materials in the future. The site interface is available in the German language only and is split into 12 subsections.

repository.rDescription: This site is an institutional repository for the 19 laboratories that make up the IN2P3 organisation. While much of the material is available in full text as represented by the size figure given here, some portions of the information are only bibliographic listings. Of this latter kind the repository lists 16,000 items. The site interface is in French with an English translation available, although some parts of the site are accessable in French only. Registered users can set up email alerts and a RSS feed is available for anyone interested in keeping up-to-date with newly added materials. The site offers a reasonably sophisticated interface offering a range of browsing options including by laboratory organisation & by arXiv & IN2P3 subject categorisation. The material within the site reflects the scientific disciplines engaged with across the organisation including applied and theoretical sciences, mathematics and engineering,

While all subjects are covered by this site currently the majority of material submitted has come from the science and technology disciplines.

Many items are not available as full text. Ktisis was named after the symbol of the Cyprus University of Technology depicting Ktisis, the spirit of creation. The symbol originates from a mosaic notation at the Efstolios house that lies in ancient Curium and originates at the start of the 5th d.c. century.

repository.rRemarks:
The Network was formed in partnership with a number of Caribbean institutions conducting scientific research and generating information.
This project comes as a direct outcome of the Caribbean Academy of Sciences, Jamaica hosting several workshops in collaboration with Inter Academy Panel, IAP, the US National Science Foundation and the Academy of Sciences for the Developing World, TWAS as part of their project on "Open Access to Scientific Literature and other Digital Scientific Information Resources in Central America and the Caribbean".
The project was carried out with the support of the UNESCO Kingston Office for the Caribbean and is a contribution to the UNESCO commitment to improve and promote Open Access to research information and add value to its Global Open Access Portal, GOAP

repository.oName: International Centre for Research in Organic Food Systems
repository.rDescription: An international subject based repository for papers related to research in organic agriculture. The site is well supported with supplementary and background information on Open Access, including an Orgprints Wiki. The archive contains full-text papers in electronic form together with bibliographic information, abstracts and other metadata. National editors from 25 countries act as editors for entries from these countries, whilst International Centre for Research in Organic Food Systems (ICROFS) handles the rest of the entries. The interface is available in both English and German.
repository.rRemarks: Partners: Research Institute of Organic Agriculture FiBL, Bundesprogramm Ökologischer Landbau Established by: Danish Research Centre for Organic Farming (now International Centre for Research in Organic Food Systems)

repository.rDescription: This site is a subject based repository providing access to datasets relating to science, with special emphasis on environmental, marine and geological basic research. repository.rDescription: A subject based repository of life sciences journal literature as well as materials deposited by individual authors. It is possible to register for an update email to ensure notification when new journals are added to the PMC collections. The size value given is the number of author submitted manuscripts.
repository.rRemarks: Partners: National Institutes of Health (NIH), National Center for Biotechnology Information (NCBI), National Library of Medicine (NLM)

This is the institutional repository of Napier University in Edinburgh. At present it contains metadata for the c800 items submitted to the RAE in 2008, together with the full-text of about twenty theses and journal articles. A university-wide mandate to deposit has been approved by the Academic Board for it is intended that this will, in time, hold the complete intellectual output of university academic staff and research students. Author, Department, Subject and Year of Publication searches are provided, together with field controlled search facilities.

repository.rRemarks:
This repository uses OAI Base URLs in a non-standard way - providing separate OAI Base URLs for each participating institution, rather than a single OAI Base URL with OAI sets for each institution. The current OAI Base URLs are: Universitat de Barcelona http://www.tdx.cat/oai/request?verb=ListRecords&metadataPrefix=oai_dc&set=hdl_10803_1

repository.rName: Universiteit van Amsterdam Digital Academic Repository
repository.uName: Library of the University of Amsterdam
repository.rDescription: University repository providing access to the publication output of the institution. While this is one repository it comprises three interface sections: the principal UvA-DARE site for all materials, and the subsections UvA Dissertations Online and UvA Scripties Online for those interested in student publications (doctoral & masters respectively). The whole site is available in English or Dutch and includes a document of the day highlighted. While there is a range of full text material openly accessible, a lot of the data on this site are bibliographical listings of all publications by institutional authors; much of which is not freely readable. Whilst this provides a showcase for the institution it diminishes the functionality for anyone expecting to be able to read all the material online significantly. The student based materials are however accessible in full-text. The site is well supported by a wealth of supporting documentation and background information. As well as the normal browse and search options there is a well implemented author showcase function.

repository.rRemarks: A well configured and easy to navigate site.

repository.rName: University of Southern California Digital Archive
repository.postalAddress: University Park Campus, University of Southern California, Los Angeles, CA 90089

repository.rRemarks: Special items include: maps.

repository.rDescription: This site is a university repository providing access to the publication output of the institution. The site is well supported with background information and guidance documentation.

repository.postalAddress: Livingstone Tower, 26 Richmond Street, Glasgow, G1 1XH
repository.rDescription: University repository providing access to the publication output of the institution. Rather bibliographic (metadata) entries are given with links to external service providers (e.g. e-journal sites) which may or may not be accessible to external users, depending upon local or personal subscriptions.
repository.rRemarks: Special items include: Web links. This site uses PURE for deposition of items.

repository.rDescription: This site provides access to the research output of the institution. Users may set up Atom and RSS feeds to be alerted to new content. The interface is available in English. Some content is only available as abstracts.

repository.rDescription: This site provides access to the output of the institution. The interface is in English.

The content of this institutional repository consists of collections produced by institutional communities, which are managed, preserved and distributed by university libraries. Communities are research producing institutional units with a defined leader responsible for setting community policy, as well as possessing long-term stability. Some collections are subject to institutional guidelines defined by institutional administration. Registered users, not limited to institutional staff, can set up email alerting when new relevant content in added.

repository.postalAddress: 10 N. 1900 E., Salt Lake City, UT 84112-5890
repository.rDescription: This is a university repository providing access to the publication output of the institution. An RSS stream will be available in the near future, but is not currently available. The site is supported by a growing range of documentation and information.

repository.uName: University of Washington Structural Informatics Group
repository.rDescription: Subject based institutional repository for materials produced or associated with this structural biological computing research group. In addition to the search and browse functions conference papers are highlighted for the years 1998-2004.

The site offers in addition to the standard searching options, a concept search construction tool. The site interface is in Spanish only. Registered users can set up email alerts to notify them of newly added relevant content. A certain level of encryption and security is embedded in the site which may cause some users accessibility problems.

This is an institutional repository that provides access to journals published by the institutions and presentations given at workshops and congresses. The interface can be viewed in English, Catalan and Spanish.

This site provides access to the output of the institution. Users may set up RSS feeds to be alerted to new content. The interface is in Portuguese and English.

Institutional repository with interface in largely in English. WaY allows for the dynamic production of bibliographic lists with links to items within the repository. Some items are available full text, however the vast majority of research publications included are simple bibliographic or abstract records, externally linked to publisher & journal Websites. As such users will be limited to accessing the full text by their respective personal or institutional journal subscriptions. Also known as Wageningen University and Researchcenter Publications. The site makes extensive use of pop-up items that may cause some users difficulties.
repository.rRemarks: Special items include: Web links

repository.rDescription: This site provides access to the research output of the institution. Users may set up Atom or RSS feeds to be alerted to new content. The interface is available in English.

repository.rRemarks: Special items: scripts

repository.rDescription: This is an academic repository for Waterford Institute of Technology, a third level college in the South of Ireland. Recent additions can be tracked in Atom or RSS. Not all items are available as open access materials, and can only be viewed by registered users.

repository.postalAddress: International School of New Media, Luebeck University
repository.rDescription: This is a subject based repository containing publications on computing and standards. Part of the WebURB knowledge and e-learning community and news service. There are some errors in the links to the full text with papers missing, raising some concerns over data stability on this site. The site is more freely wheeling and vague in its policies than many repository sites, and as such whilst making use of the materials available is easy, understanding who or how to deposit materials clearly is far more problematic.

An institutional repository for the University of Westminster, containing research produced from 2001 onwards. Currently 12% of all items have openly available full-text (~650), and the majority of these materials are journal articles or conference papers.
